00043 template<typename T, bool isNumber> class type_compare
00044 {
00045 public:
00046     type_compare() {} // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00047     bool operator()( const util::Value<T> &/*first*/, const ValueBase &/*second*/ )const {
00048         LOG( Debug, error ) << "comparison of " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << " is not supportet";
00049         return false;
00050     }
00051 };
00052 
00063 template<typename T> class type_compare<T, true>
00064 {
00065 protected:
00066     virtual bool posOverflow( const util::Value<T> &/*first*/, const util::Value<T> &/*second*/ )const {return false;} //default to false
00067     virtual bool negOverflow( const util::Value<T> &/*first*/, const util::Value<T> &/*second*/ )const {return false;} //default to false
00068     virtual bool inRange( const util::Value<T> &/*first*/, const util::Value<T> &/*second*/ )const {return false;} //default to false
00069 public:
00070     bool operator()( const util::Value<T> &first, const ValueBase &second )const {
00071         // ask second for a converter from itself to Value<T>
00072         const ValueBase::Converter conv = second.getConverterTo( util::Value<T>::staticID );
00073 
00074         if ( conv ) {
00075             //try to convert second into T and handle results
00076             util::Value<T> buff;
00077 
00078             switch ( conv->convert( second, buff ) ) {
00079             case boost::numeric::cPosOverflow:
00080                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Positive overflow when converting " << second.toString( true ) << " to " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << ".";
00081                 return posOverflow( first, buff );
00082             case boost::numeric::cNegOverflow:
00083                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Negative overflow when converting " << second.toString( true ) << " to " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << ".";
00084                 return negOverflow( first, buff );
00085             case boost::numeric::cInRange:
00086                 return inRange( first, buff );
00087             }
00088         } else {
00089             LOG( Debug, error ) << "No conversion of " << second.getTypeName() << " to " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << " available";
00090             return false;
00091         }
00092 
00093         return false;
00094     }
00095     type_compare() {} // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00096     virtual ~type_compare() {}
00097 };
00098 
00099 template<typename T, bool isNumber> class type_less : public type_compare<T, isNumber>
00100 {
00101 public: // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00102     type_less() {}
00103 };// we are going to specialize this for numeric T below
00104 template<typename T, bool isNumber> class type_greater : public type_compare<T, isNumber>
00105 {
00106 public: // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00107     type_greater() {}
00108 };
00109 template<typename T, bool isNumber> class type_eq : public type_compare<T, isNumber>
00110 {
00111 protected:
00112     bool inRange( const util::Value<T> &first, const util::Value<T> &second )const {
00113         return static_cast<const T &>( first ) == static_cast<const T &>( second );
00114     }
00115 public: // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00116     type_eq() {}
00117 };
00118 
00120 template<typename T> class type_less<T, true> : public type_compare<T, true>
00121 {
00122 protected:
00123     bool posOverflow( const util::Value<T> &/*first*/, const util::Value<T> &/*second*/ )const {
00124         return true; //getting an positive overflow when trying to convert second into T, obviously means first is less
00125     }
00126     bool inRange( const util::Value<T> &first, const util::Value<T> &second )const {
00127         return static_cast<const T &>( first ) < static_cast<const T &>( second );
00128     }
00129 public: // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00130     type_less() {}
00131 };
00132 
00134 template<typename T> class type_greater<T, true> : public type_compare<T, true>
00135 {
00136 protected:
00137     bool negOverflow( const util::Value<T> &/*first*/, const util::Value<T> &/*second*/ )const {
00138         return true; //getting an negative overflow when trying to convert second into T, obviously means first is greater
00139     }
00140     bool inRange( const util::Value<T> &first, const util::Value<T> &second )const {
00141         return static_cast<const T &>( first ) > static_cast<const T &>( second );
00142     }
00143 public: // c++11 says we need a user defined constructor here
00144     type_greater() {}
00145 };

00161 template<typename TYPE> class Value: public _internal::ValueBase
00162 {
00163     TYPE m_val;
00164     static const char m_typeName[];
00165 protected:
00166     ValueBase *clone() const {
00167         return new Value<TYPE>( *this );
00168     }
00169 public:
00170     static const unsigned short staticID = _internal::TypeID<TYPE>::value;
00171     Value(): m_val() {
00172         BOOST_MPL_ASSERT_RELATION( staticID, < , 0xFF );
00173         checkType<TYPE>();
00174     }
00182     template<typename T> Value( const T &value ) {
00183         m_val = _internal::__cast_to<TYPE>()( this, value );
00184         BOOST_MPL_ASSERT_RELATION( staticID, < , 0xFF );
00185         checkType<TYPE>();
00186     }
00194     std::string toString( bool labeled = false )const {
00195         std::string ret;
00196         Reference ref = copyByID( Value<std::string>::staticID );
00197 
00198         if ( ref.isEmpty() ) {
00199             LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Automatic conversion of " << *this << " to string failed. Falling back to boost::lexical_cast<std::string>";
00200             ret = boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( m_val );
00201         } else {
00202             ret = ref->castTo<std::string>();
00203         }
00204 
00205         if ( labeled )ret += "(" + staticName() + ")";
00206 
00207         return ret;
00208     }
00209 
00210     std::string getTypeName()const {return staticName();}
00211     unsigned short getTypeID()const {return staticID;}
00212     bool isFloat() const {return boost::is_float< TYPE >::value;}
00213     bool isInteger() const {return boost::is_integral< TYPE >::value;}
00214 
00216     virtual bool operator==( const ValueBase &second )const {
00217         if ( second.is<TYPE>() ) {
00218             return m_val == second.castTo<TYPE>();
00219         } else
00220             return  false;
00221     }
00222 
00224     static std::string staticName() {return m_typeName;}
00225 
00237     operator const TYPE &()const {return m_val;}
00238 
00250     operator TYPE &() {return m_val;}
00251 
00261     bool gt( const _internal::ValueBase &ref )const {
00262         static const _internal::type_greater<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value > greater;
00263         return greater.operator()( *this, ref );
00264     }
00265 
00275     bool lt( const _internal::ValueBase &ref )const {
00276         static const _internal::type_less<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value > less;
00277         return less( *this, ref );
00278     }
00279 
00289     bool eq( const _internal::ValueBase &ref )const {
00290         static const _internal::type_eq<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value > equal;
00291         return equal( *this, ref );
00292     }
00293 
00294     virtual ~Value() {}
00295 };

00297 template<typename T> const util::Value<T>& _internal::ValueBase::castToType() const
00298 {
00299     checkType<T>();
00300     return m_cast_to<util::Value<T> >();
00301 }
00302 template<typename T> const T &_internal::ValueBase::castTo() const
00303 {
00304     const util::Value<T> &ret = castToType<T>();
00305     return ret.operator const T & ();
00306 }
00307 template<typename T> util::Value<T>& _internal::ValueBase::castToType()
00308 {
00309     checkType<T>();
00310     return m_cast_to<util::Value<T> >();
00311 }
00312 template<typename T> T &_internal::ValueBase::castTo()
00313 {
00314     util::Value<T> &ret = castToType<T>();
00315     return ret.operator T & ();
00316 }

00318 template<typename T> bool _internal::ValueBase::is()const
00319 {
00320     checkType<T>();
00321     return getTypeID() == util::Value<T>::staticID;
00322 }
